intro: Barleria cardiocalyx, commonly known as the heartleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its glossy, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms. The species is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
